item.title: The 'Right to Bear Arms' Is Not More Important Than a Child's Right to Grow Up
item.description: "The 'right to bear arms' is not more important than a child's right to grow up" --@dcorneal http://t.co/BHGE75Uq
item.content:encoded: "The 'right to bear arms' is not more important than a child's right to grow up" --@dcorneal http://t.co/BHGE75Uq Every day we send the most vulnerable members of our society their classrooms, and they're turning into shooting galleries. item.content:encoded: Today is NOT the day to talk about gun control, Today is the day to finally DO SOMETHING about it! http://t.co/PMckEnAr I am absolutely sick to my stomach. My hands shake. My heart sinks. My mind is numb. We are all sick to our stomachs. We all shake with the deepest sadness we possibly can imagine. An unimaginable sadness. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: globalgrind.com

item.title: Newtown and the Madness of Guns
item.description: Adam Gopnik: "The people who fight to make guns regularly available are complicit in the murder of those children." http://t.co/3B0gcqOH
item.content:encoded: Adam Gopnik: "The people who fight to make guns regularly available are complicit in the murder of those children." http://t.co/3B0gcqOH The people who fight and lobby and legislate to make guns regularly available are complicit in the murder of those children. They have made a clear moral choice: that the comfort and emotional reassurance they take from the possession of guns is, placed in the balance even against the routine murder of innocent children, of supreme value., The people who fight and lobby and legislate to make guns regularly available are complicit in the murder of those children. They have made a clear moral choice: that the comfort and emotional reassurance they take from the possession of guns is, placed in the balance even against the routine murder of innocent children, of supreme value. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: newyorker.com

item.content:encoded: How To Help Sandy Hook Community http://t.co/c5X7rQlP via @HuffPostImpact As the details of a mass shooting at an elementary school in Connecticut continue to unfold, local mental health professionals and aid organizations are stepping forward to help those affected by the tragedy. item.title: fred rogers company
item.description: PARENTS (and everyone really): Mr. Rogers is still relevant & wise. Take a second to read this… http://t.co/PgGRMx0J
item.content:encoded: PARENTS (and everyone really): Mr. Rogers is still relevant & wise. Take a second to read this… http://t.co/PgGRMx0J "When I was a boy and I would see scary things in the news, my mother would say to me, "Look for the helpers. You will always find people who are helping." To this day, especially in times of "disaster," I remember my mother's words and I am always comforted by realizing that there are still so many helpers – so many caring people in this world." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: fci.org

item.title: Gunman kills 26 at Conn. school, commits suicide
item.description: Connecticut gunman had ties to school; 1 of guns was .223-caliber rifle, law enforcement official says - @AP http://t.co/Dy6rmplp
item.content:encoded: Connecticut gunman had ties to school; 1 of guns was .223-caliber rifle, law enforcement official says - @AP http://t.co/Dy6rmplp NEWTOWN, Conn. (AP) -- A man killed his mother at their home and then opened fire Friday inside the elementary school where she taught, massacring 26 people, including 20 children, as youngsters cowered in fear to the sound of gunshots reverberating through the building and screams echoing over the intercom. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ap.org
